title: Data-Driven High-Energy-Density Hydrocarbon Fuel Design Strategy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic chemistry and thermodynamics concepts, with experience in data analysis tools
context.additional_context: Targeting pre-service/in-service teachers, focusing on cultivating energy problem-solving abilities within social contexts using data-driven design strategies

learning_goals: Learners can analyze molecular structure data from the ZINC20 database to explain correlations between high-energy density properties.
Learners can quantitatively evaluate fuel performance by applying group contribution methods and computational chemistry (DFT) methodologies.
Learners can interpret synthetic complexity prediction results using neural network models and propose practical fuel design strategies.

resources: Access to the ZINC20 molecular database
Python-based computational chemistry tools (Python, RDKit, PyTorch)
DFT (Density Functional Theory) calculation sample dataset

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
